alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 25 at 6:25PM EDT until July 25 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL ALAMANCE AND ORANGE COUNTIES... At 624 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mebane, or 8 miles northeast of Graham, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Chapel Hill, Burlington, Graham, Hillsborough, Carrboro, Mebane, Haw River, Swepsonville, Alamance and Carr. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
